snippet: Health officials warned of an alarming increase in infections in Athens, particularly among intravenous drug users, as Greece struggled through a financial crisis.
abstract: Health officials in Greece warn of alarming increase in HIV infections in Athens, particularly among intravenous drug users, as Greece struggles through financial crisis that has led to deep cuts in health care and drug treatment programs.
lead_paragraph: Health officials warned of an alarming increase in infections in Athens, particularly among intravenous drug users, as Greece struggled through a financial crisis.
